config.asyncparticles.mixin.create.contr: Disable particle collisions on certain contraption classes.
config.asyncparticles.mixin.particle.inv: Class not found or not a subclass of 'net.minecraft.client.particle.Particle'!
config.asyncparticles.mixin.particle.saf:
Never enable this unless you're experiencing crashes,
try 'Replace RandomSource' first!
Make LegacyRandomSource thread-safe to avoid concurrency crashes.
config.asyncparticles.mixin.safeBlockEnt:
Enable this if you're encountering crashes related
to non-standard particle implementations in your
installed mods that access block entities in the world.
config.asyncparticles.mixin.safeClassIns:
Enable this if you're encountering crashes related
to non-standard particle implementations in your
installed mods that access entities in the world.
config.asyncparticles.mixin.tooltip:
Default entries can't be deleted.
(Reset to default by removing all entries.)
config.asyncparticles.mod-compat.coopart: If you encounter any issues related to it, try changing it.
Control when rain effects spawn
on Create contraptions.
config.asyncparticles.mod-compat.valkyri: Fix lighting issues with particles on ships.

Control when rain effects appear
on Valkyrien Skies ships.
config.asyncparticles.particle.cullUnder:
On non-Fabulous graphics, enabling this
makes 'UNDERWATER' particles appear only
when you're actually underwater.
config.asyncparticles.particle.particleL:
Enable caching of particle lighting
for performance.

Set the maximum number of particles per
'ParticleRenderType'.
config.asyncparticles.particle.removeIfM: Remove the particle if the async task is interrupted before it is ticked.
config.asyncparticles.rendering.cullWeat: Cull weathers outside the camera view.
config.asyncparticles.rendering.failBeha:
Action taken when rendering failures
exceed the limit.
config.asyncparticles.rendering.failPerS:
Maximum rendering failures per second allowed
per particle class. Exceeding this will follow
the 'Failure Behavior' setting.
config.asyncparticles.rendering.particle:
Cull particles outside the camera view.
'Sphere (Real Time)' is recommended.
'Box (Real Time)' is the legacy implementation,
slower but more accurate.
'Sphere (Async, Per Tick)' and 'Box (Async, Per Tick)'
are faster, but may delay rendering of particles near
screen edges when turning the camera too quickly.
'Sphere' modes may be incompatible with certain mods.
'Disable' disables particle culling.

Choose how particles are rendered.
'Compatibility' improves mod compatibility
but reduce performance slightly.
Automatically enabled when using shader packs.
'Synchronously' disables the optimization.
'Compatibility' and 'Synchronously
support rendering opaque particles underwater
(Iris mod required on Fabric).
config.asyncparticles.tick.animationTick:
Choose how animations are ticked.
.'Synchronously' means no optimization.
Action to take when failure rate
exceeds the limit.
config.asyncparticles.tick.failPerSecLim:
Max number of tick failures allowed per second
for each particle class or end-tick op.
Exceeding this will follow the 'Failure Behavior'
rule.
config.asyncparticles.tick.particleTickM:
Choose how particles are ticked.
'Synchronously' means no optimization.
config.asyncparticles.tick.suppressCME.t:
Ignore 'ConcurrentModificationException'
while under 'Fail Per Second Limit'.
gui.asyncparticles.menu-unavailable.mess:
Please install Cloth Config API to access the config menu.
You can also make changes manually and click 'Reload Config'.
Hold SHIFT to show the reset button.
gui.asyncparticles.reload-confirmation: Do you want to reload the configuration?
gui.asyncparticles.reset-confirmation: Do you want to reset all configurations?
